toLevel5.question: Why is it scientifically incorrect to say that mass is 'destroyed' in nuclear reactions?
toLevel5.correct: Mass-energy is conserved; mass is converted to an equivalent amount of energy
toLevel5.correctExplanation: Total mass-energy is always conserved. Mass isn't destroyed but transforms into energy. The reaction products plus released energy equal the initial mass-energy.
